humanum_full_description_en:
The shape is like a beard under the cheeks, with a short painting pen on the upper part. The original meaning is cheek hair. It was later borrowed as a conjunction, so the characters "ËÄè" and "È´µ" were created to preserve the original meaning.

Oracle shape, Tang Lan, Seigo are interpreted as " and ." Li Po according to Jin Ding multi-Friends " Guo lower part of" From the word that is shaped to do this is when the word " Guo beginning of the text", the head of hair shaped like inverted and should not be construed as " and " word. Ji Xusheng did not rule out the possibility of having the same shape with the two characters. The characters resemble cheek hair. After a person beheaded, only cheek hair can be seen. Therefore, it is both the character " and " and the original article of " Fan ." The character " and " is written in various ways in the Warring States period, and some of the characters " and " are easily mixed with the character "Â§©". See " Heaven ".

The word " and " in the oracle bone inscriptions is used as "ËÉπ", which is interpreted as the name of the sacrifice, and cooked food is used for sacrifice. Such as "Collection" 10989: "And (ËÉπ) dagger (Â¶£) Ren" refers to the sacrifice of concubines with cooked food. Books handed down " cook " and the " Er " Universal, overripe word has meaning. In addition, the word " and " can also be used as "Èôë", which is used as a place name, such as "He Ji" 15588: "Â∞û (Â∞û) Yuer (Èôë)." That is, the sing festival is held in the place of Zheng.

The Chinese character " and " is used as a second-person pronoun, and is used the same as " er " and "Â•≥(Ê±ù)". Such as the uncle's clock: "Women (you) do not (lazy), but you are not lazy at night and (er) political affairs." It means that you are not lazy and perform your duties day and night. This usage is also used in handed down documents, such as "Zuo Zhuan. "Twenty Years of Zhaogong": "I know but I am not guilty." Du's pre-note: "And, it is also a female." " And " and "Female (Ru)" are equivalent to today's " you ". In addition, the word " and " can be used as a conjunction in inscriptions. For example, Zhongshan Wangding: "Er's mother (wu) is big and wanton, mother (wu) is rich and Qiao (arrogant), mother (wu) is crowded." "The Analects. "Xue Er": "Zigong said: "Poverty without flattery, rich without arrogance, how?""

The word " and " is not used as the original meaning in the Jia Jin inscriptions, but in the handed down literature, examples can be found for the beard under the cheeks. Such as "Zhou Li. "Kaogongji": "Being the scales." Wang Yinzhi said: "And, the cheek hair. It is still and also. When the scales are used, the scales and the cheek hair are also called." It means to highlight it. The scales and cheek hair. Since the word " and " was later borrowed as a conjunction and was no longer used as its original meaning, the word "ÂΩ°" was added to make "ËÄè", or "È´ü" was added to make "È´µ" to express its original meaning.

"Shuowen": "And, cheek hair is also like hair. "Zhou Li" said: "For its scales." Everything is like this."
